overview: Fred Lawrence is thought of as a skilled executive who has been building teams and guiding companies to significant successes in the telecommunications and technology markets for the past 39 years. Fred started his career as an engineer with Michigan Bell and departed AT&T as a Division Manager in New York twelve years later when he joined Sprint Corporation as President of United Telephone of Florida a $1.2 billion telco. Fred was tasked by the Sprint Board of Directors as the senior executive to lead the planning, engineering, construction and maintenance of Sprint’s state-of-the-art $3.5 billion global fiber optic network. The first ever fiber optic network in the world.After a successful tenure at Sprint, Fred joined ADC Telecommunications as President of the Transmission Group a $400 million business unit and was responsible for product lines ranging from optical transmission systems and wireless transmission systems to voice/video/data networking systems and was responsible for consistent year over year growth of 25%.
